name: Intro to Letterpress Class For Designers
description:
Are more and more of your clients requesting letterpress business cards, or wanting to see some examples of stationery or marketing materials using letterpress "texture" and "saltiness?" We'd love to show you how we create those pieces and how to get the most out of a deep impression starting with your computer designs. 

You will learn how different ink colors, line weights, and floods appear when in print and on different types of papers. We'll teach you how to set up files for letterpress plates, design pieces that will offer the greatest impression when printed on certain presses and paper, and how many of our 7 presses work. We will also show you how to set up a project using wood or lead type to get in touch with the foundation of graphic design.

No prerequisites necessary, although it is important that you have a working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and/or inDesign.

name: Personalized Letterpress Holiday Card Workshop
description:
Make a good impression with your own letterpress Holiday Cards! Join us to print some personalized cards for yourself or your family.

Using our antique wood type or lead type, hand-set your family name, greeting, or monogram on an A7 folded card. You will get to take home 25 cards and matching envelopes. Additional cards may be printed for $2 each. This outing is perfect for the whole family!

After registering, please email us for specific times and a Saturday that will work for you. Please note, if you are interested in an in-depth class on letterpress, please check out our Intro to Letterpress class. This project is a shorter event specifically designed as a quick and easy take-home project.

(Images shown are just an example of the fun things you can create!)

name: Wood Type Notebook Class
description:
Do you need a last-minute gift for the holidays!? Create a beautiful Wood Type perfect-bound book! Using our antique wood type or lead type, hand-set your own name, greeting, or monogram on a bright paper, letterpress print the cover and attach the cover to the perfect bound book! You will get to take home 1 book, and additional books may be made for $18 each. This outing is perfect for the whole family!

(Images shown are just an example of the fun things you can create!)

name: Custom Letterpress Poster Class
description:
Create a one-of-a-kind WoodType Poster for your friends, family, and loved ones by printing your own! Using our antique wood type, hand-set your favorite saying, greeting, or name on a 11x17 poster. You will get to take home 6 copies for gifts. Additional posters may be printed for $10 each. This outing is perfect for the whole family!

(If this date doesn't work for you, please contact us at info@iglooletterpress.com to set up an appointment.)

(Images shown are just an example of the fun things you can create!)

name: Intro to Letterpress Class
description:
Love the look of letterpress? Want to talk about the value of a kiss versus a heavy bite impression on your paper? Do you want to understand how to use antique wood and lead type to create works of art? 

In addition to an introductory project we will have set on press, each student will use hand-set type to create a personal project. You will learn your way around both a platen press and a Vandercook. File prep for photopolymer plates will be explained for future projects.

No printing experience required! This class is appropriate for ages 15 and up, under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. We will need a minimum of 2 students for the class to run, with no more than 4 in each class. If you are interested in setting up a private session or another date for your group, please email Beth at info@iglooletterpress.com.

name: Hardback Journal Bookbinding Class
description: Learn a classic hardback bookbinding technique and take home a beautiful journal. You will create the book from choosing the cloth and paper, to cutting the book-board to hand-sewing the pages. There is nothing like writing or sketching in the pages of a freshly bound book, made by you!

name: Personalized Letterpress Stationery Workshop
description:
Make a good impression with your own letterpress stationery! Join us to print some personalized notecards for yourself or a gift, get to know a little bit about letterpress, and have fun!

Using our antique wood type or lead type, hand-set your own name, greeting, or monogram on an A2 flat Crane Lettra card. You will get to take home 15 cards and matching envelopes. Additional cards may be printed for $1.50 each. This outing is perfect for the whole family!

After registering, please email us for specific times and a Saturday that will work for you. Please note, if you are interested in an in-depth class on letterpress, please check out our Intro to Letterpress class. This project is a shorter event specifically designed as a quick and easy take-home project.

(Images shown are just an example of the fun things you can create!)

name: Paper Wreath Making Class
description:
Being letterpress printers, we believe that paper is anything but 2-dimensional. We bring paper and images to life in a variety of ways, but have the most fun when we're able to create 3D sculptures, including wreaths, out of beautiful printed paper. 

We will have everything that you need to create a beautiful fall or holiday wreath, including the wreath form, glue, printed leaves, holly and berries, and the instruction for how to put it all together. This makes a great outing for friends or family members, and makes a perfect gift or home decor that will last forever.

(This project is geared for ages 16 and up.)

(Images shown are just an example of the fun things you can create!)

name: Intro to Bookbinding Class
description: Learn how to work with paper, glue, needle and thread to create your own handmade books. Each student will create a multi-signature hardcover book as well as softcover pamphlet and stab binding.

name: Letterpress Class - Advanced Printing Techniques
description:
Have you taken Intro to Letterpress (or know the basics of the art of letterpress)? Do you want to take it to the next level? We love the look of one-color printing with a great bite, but adding multiple colors or using techniques such as hand-inking or split-fountain inking can bring simple designs to life.

In addition to an introductory project we will have set on press, each student will use hand-set type to create a personal project. You will learn your way around both a platen press and a Vandercook. You will set up a design for 2-color printing and also try another technique like hand-inking, pressure printing, or split-fountain.

We do ask that you have either taken Intro to Letterpress at Igloo or have a basic knowledge of letterpress, as we will not be covering the basics or history. This class is appropriate for ages 15 and up, under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. We will need a minimum of 2 students for the class to run, with no more than 4 in each class. If you are interested in setting up a private session or another date for your group, please email Beth at info@iglooletterpress.com.

name: Farmer's Market "We've Got the Blues" Poster
description:
This beautiful 3-color letterpress poster is the sixth in our Farmer's Market series by Will Ruocco Art and Design and printed by Igloo Letterpress! Quantities are limited.

11x17 printed on French Paper Company True White 100#

name: 123 Poster - Rainbow Letterpress
description:
This 11x17 is overprinted in three primary colors, which creates five colors when overprinted in transparent letterpress inks. Perfect for a school, office, nursery, or child's room.

Igloo is a small but mighty letterpress studio, retail shop and commercial printer in central Ohio that strives to walk the Midwest line of rural and urban, traditional and progressive. Our roots are steeped in history and we are passionate about using our extensive collection of wood and lead type and beautiful vintage image cuts. However, we love pushing the envelope - forgive the pun - and experimenting with new and new-found printing techniques such as pressure printing, screens, half-tones, overprinting, metallics, and new bookbinding techniques.

However, we love pushing the envelope - forgive the pun - and experimenting with new and new-found printing techniques such as pressure printing, screens, half-tones, overprinting, metallics, and new bookbinding techniques.

name: 2013 Graduation Card
description: This A2 card is the perfect thing to send to that special grad in your life. Designed by Rachel of Imaginary Beast, we printed it using mint ink on our bright Sweet Tooth french paper, paired with a warm gray envelope.

name: My Typo Gay Funny Letterpess Valentine
description:
Show that guy or gal in your life how much you care - about them and about type!

This letterpress card is an A2 size (4.25"x5.5") printed on 100# heavy card stock (French Paper Company's Sweet Tooth) with a kraft envelope. 

Igloo is a small but mighty letterpress studio, retail shop and commercial printer in central Ohio that strives to walk the Midwest line of rural and urban, traditional and progressive. Our roots are steeped in history and we are passionate about using our extensive collection of wood and lead type and beautiful vintage image cuts. However, we love pushing the envelope - forgive the pun - and experimenting with new and new-found printing techniques such as pressure printing, screens, half-tones, overprinting, metallics, and new bookbinding techniques.

name: Shhh... Letterpress Poster
description:
This whimsical poster is a soft reminder for a library, bedroom, or cozy reading nook. We used Crane's Crest coverstock in warm white, our hand-set antique wood type and vintage acid-etched metal border, and salty black ink. It is sure to warm up any home.

The textured quality of the printing is indicative of the antique hand-carved wood type and etched metal border. Please click through the pictures to see some in-progress pictures of how we printed them our 1942 Vandercook #4 press. Because the 100-year-old typeface only had 2 remaining "h's," we ran through a "Shh ..." with a space for the final "h" and then ran it though again to complete the "Shhh..."

Featured in the March 2013 issue of Country Living Magazine!

name: Farmer's Market "Good Gourd" Pumpkin Poster
description:
This beautiful 3-color letterpress poster is the fourth in our Farmer's Market series by Will Ruocco Art and Design and printed by Igloo Letterpress! Quantities are limited.

11x17

name: Farmer's Market "Sweet" Strawberry Poster
description:

11x17

name: 2014 Letterpress Desk Calendar - Limited Edition
description:
Desk space is at a premium these days, what with iPads, monitors, pencil cups, and phones taking up room, adding a calendar is not something to take lightly! You need a beautiful calendar, one that makes you happy on cloudy days, one that feels good to touch and pet, and one that is sure to - wait for it - IMPRESS your coworkers.

Our 2014 Letterpress Desk Calendar hits those lofty goals and more. Printed on 62 pt. creative board using antique wood type in a stunning elongated serif font, we used 9 transparent but saturated colors overlapping to create countless others. 6 2-sided cards fit together in a hand-made wooden base created by Ohio's favorite toy maker, Little Alouette (littlealouette.com) using sustainably farmed Ohio maple. 

These are limited edition, so get them while you can!

name: Columbus Bingo Cards
description: We love our city, so much so that we've immortalized it in our Columbus Bingo Cards. Each is printed on French Paper Company Pop-Tone paper, and is a different board per color. Sold in sets of 4, one of each board/color.

name: Letterpress Gift Wrap, Happy Birthday Wood Type
description:
Wrap your gifts in the beauty and tradition of letterpress printing.  Each decorative sheet is printed one-at-a-time using hand-set antique wood type that is literally pressed into the paper.  This process leaves a beautiful impression that you can see and feel!.  

There will be slight variations from sheet to sheet because of the manual nature of letterpress printing.

2 sheets included
29"x22"

name: Letterpress Autumn Leaf Wreath
description: It takes a lot to make something this beautiful. First, we choose sparkling metallic paper and letterpress a hand-carved bronze leaf plate onto it using a Kelsey press. We then hand-cut each leaf to make them unique pieces of art and crease in just the right places so the light catches them just right. We then hand-glue them into a 12" wreath so that you can enjoy the beauty of the autumn all year round.

name: World Map Cards - A2 folded landscape
description:
A folded card opening wide, paired with a glassine vellum envelope.

Once upon a time, we worked with a great design duo, These Are Things, to print some beautiful letterpress World Maps. They turned out beautifully, and are available to buy for your very own on their website here: http://shop.thesearethings.com/products/dual-hemispheres-map. The bright turquoise blue waves and coral continents are oh-so-touchable on 100% cotton Crane's Lettra; you won't be able to stop petting them.

The nature of letterpress printing, however, means that there is a lot of set-up and finagling and proofing to get things perfect. We were close to perfect on so many, but not quite, and we had a bunch of first-run prints left over. So, in true Reuse, Recycle, Reduce, Repurpose fashion, we have created a limited edition line of World Map products. Get them now because when they're gone, they're gone! And we will be sure to be even closer to perfect next time.

name: DIY Book Kit: Flag Book
description:
Have you ever wanted to learn how to make books by hand? Our Book Kits are a great place to start. They include everything you need to create the book shown, and make great gifts to the DIY-er in your life.

Our newest book kit creates a beautiful and unique book perfect for all ages. The book can be "read" traditionally or pulled out to create a special series of stories or photographs.

Igloo Letterpress was founded in 1996 using a 19th century press and a collection of vintage images and type passed down to owner Allison Chapman from her Grandad. It is this treasure trove that serves as her inspiration for projects and inventive new books and cards. Igloo Letterpress is located in downtown Worthington, Ohio, ten minutes from the urban center of Columbus and ten minutes from miles of beautiful farmland. Igloo walks this unique geographical line to create refreshing designs using found local plates and types. The result is truly urban, truly rural, and Truly Midwest.

Your piece may differ slightly from what appears in the picture, due to slight variations in the printing process and ink. This original artwork is copyright Igloo Letterpress 2011. Copyright is not transferable with the sale of this print. The buyer is not entitled to reproduction rights. The item will be shipped flat in a protective mailer.

name: Hand-inked American Flag Posters
description:
When we discovered that the back of one of our woodtype typefaces had stunning wood-grooves and lines, we immediately decided it had to be a flag. So, we grabbed all of our stars and hand-set a beautiful flag poster. 

Size 14" x 9.5", colors will vary slightly due to the hand-inking process. We promise they are all awesome.

name: Thank-You Notecards: Wood Type Jumble
description:
Congrats! You've taken a big step in coming here - your desire to show people gratitude for their kindness by sending them fabulous thank you notes means you are an official great person. We adore these cards and think there is no better way to show your appreciation to the supportive and generous people in your life.

These thank-you notecards are a folded 100# cotton paper, imprinted with a fun jumble of our antique wood type. 

Each card will include a coordinating A2 envelope, and you may choose your quantity below. Please include in your order the color of ink you think best expresses your personality and we will do our best to match it.

name: Personalized Notecard: Alternate Gothic
description:
There are many milestones we reach as we grow in adulthood: our first crush, middle school graduation, first car...but one that is often overlooked is the first time we find ourselves in desperate need of personalized stationery to keep up our correspondence with business colleagues. This can happen at 5 years of age, at 25, or at 95; but, rest assured, you will need personalized notecards.

We have come to the rescue! Our notecards are made using hand-set lead type in 14 point Alternate Gothic on 100# cotton paper. Please specify the name you would like, be it your own, your Nana's, or your child (because that is how you will be most judged). 

Each flat card will include a coordinating A2 envelope, and you may choose your quantity below. Please include in your order the color of ink you think best expresses your personality and we will do our best to match it.

name: Spewing Monster Cards
description:
So you go into a card store looking for the perfect card. You think, man, if only they had an awesome card featuring a Monster throwing up festive things. Then you walk out, empty-handed.

Until now.

Illustrator (and former fabulous intern) Kira Keck brought us these incredible little guys, and we were thrilled to make them into adorable cards. Choose from Thank You, New Baby, Good Luck, Happy Birthday and Easter. We will surprise you with one of the variety of colors! (blank inside)

name: Bicycle Calling Cards
description:
It has happened over and over again, you see the same people biking to work while you bike to work. You wave and smile, just to see them again the next day. It's getting awkward. You don't know their name, but you know their bike like the back of your handlebars.

We have the solution: Bicycle Calling Cards! Break the awkwardness and introduce yourself! Better yet, start riding together! Get to know each other! Make friends! Make the world a bit less awkward!

You get 10 beautiful letterpress cards, in assorted colors. We printed these using hand-set antique lead type on a vintage Kelsey press on French paper. We promise you will love them.

name: Love Ya Mama Letterpress Card
description:
Punchy color and a fun message letterpress printed using antique wood type. The perfect way to brighten someone's day!

This letterpress card is an A2 size (4.25"x5.5") printed on 100# heavy card stock (French Paper Company's Sweet Tooth) with a kraft envelope. 

Igloo Letterpress is a small but mighty letterpress studio, retail shop and commercial printer in central Ohio that strives to walk the Midwest line of rural and urban, traditional and progressive. Our roots are steeped in history and we are passionate about using our extensive collection of wood and lead type and beautiful vintage image cuts. However, we love pushing the envelope - forgive the pun - and experimenting with new and new-found printing techniques such as pressure printing, screens, half-tones, overprinting, metallics, and new bookbinding techniques.

name: XOXO Letterpress Card
description:
Fresh color and simple design are sure to please your loved ones. Designed by Carrie O'Neal.

Igloo is a small but mighty letterpress studio, retail shop and commercial printer in central Ohio that strives to walk the Midwest line of rural and urban, traditional and progressive. Our roots are steeped in history and we are passionate about using our extensive collection of wood and lead type and beautiful vintage image cuts. However, we love pushing the envelope - forgive the pun - and experimenting with new and new-found printing techniques such as pressure printing, screens, half-tones, overprinting, metallics, and new bookbinding techniques.
